content.text: When you identify a security incident, swift action matters. Here's exactly how to report it at ClearTriage.

**Primary Contact:** Pete Allen (CTO)

**Secondary Contact:** Dave Schmitt (President) - if Pete unavailable
You have their contact info. Use Slack for most incidents, phone for urgent situations.
Provide this information (as much as you can gather quickly):

items: **What happened** - Brief description of what you observed
**Where** - Which system, service, or location (AWS, Google Drive, specific app)
**Who** - Any users, accounts, or external parties involved
**Impact** - What's affected or at risk (data, services, access)

content.title: Good Initial Report
content.content: "Pete - I just noticed unusual login attempts on our AWS production account from an IP in Russia. Started seeing CloudTrail alerts about 10 minutes ago (2:15 PM). Multiple failed attempts on the admin console. I'm watching it now - seems ongoing."

content.text: Don't wait for perfect information. Report what you know immediately.

items: **Your job**: Report within minutes of discovery
**Pete's job**: FedRAMP notification within 1 hour for CAT 1 incidents (unauthorized access)
**Don't delay** reporting to gather more info - Pete needs time to meet FedRAMP deadlines
Pete handles all external communications (agencies, FedRAMP, customers)
You may be asked to preserve evidence: screenshot everything, don't delete anything, stay available
Don't investigate on your own or discuss outside the team
If Pete creates a Slack thread for the incident, keep all discussion there

content.text: That's it. Report fast, let leadership handle the rest.
